qas.question: Who is viewed as the first modern geologist?
In 1785 James Hutton presented what paper to the Royal Society of Edinburgh?
James Hutton published a 2 volume version of his theories in what year?
What was the main idea of James Hutton's paper?

answers.text: Earth must be much older than had previously been supposed
Earth must be much older than had previously been supposed
the Earth must be much older than had previously been supposed

qas.question: When was the Royal Society of Edinburgh founded?

plausible_answers.text: a paper entitled Theory of the Earth

qas.question: What did the Royal Society of Edinburgh present in 1785?

plausible_answers.text: the Earth must be much older than had previously been supposed

qas.question: What was the theory the Royal Society presented?

plausible_answers.text: in order to allow enough time for mountains to be eroded and for sediments to form new rocks at the bottom of the sea

qas.question: Why did the Royal Society think the Earth was older than previously thought?
When was the Royal Society of Edinburgh formed?

plausible_answers.text: to allow enough time for mountains to be eroded and for sediments to form new rocks

qas.question: Why did Hutton believe the earth needed to be much younger than previously believed?
